intro: Corchorus longipedunculatus, commonly known as the Indian mallow or velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow to greenish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is known for its fibrous stems. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. The plant has been used traditionally for its medicinal properties and as a source of fiber.
